low.question: On Windows, which keyboard shortcut copies the currently selected text or files to the clipboard?
On Windows, which keyboard shortcut pastes the clipboard contents into the active document or field?

Which common keyboard shortcut saves the current document or file in many desktop applications?
Which shortcut opens the Find dialog to search within a document in most desktop programs?
Which shortcut selects all text and items in the current window or document on Windows?
Which keyboard shortcut opens a new tab in most desktop web browsers?
Which keyboard shortcut reopens the last closed tab in most modern web browsers?
On Windows, which keyboard shortcut cycles through open applications and windows?
On macOS, which keyboard shortcut copies the currently selected text, files, or items to the clipboard?
On macOS, which keyboard shortcut pastes the clipboard contents into the frontmost application or field?
Which function key commonly opens the help system or documentation in many desktop applications?
Which shortcut closes the current window or application window on Windows platforms?
Which keyboard shortcut closes the current tab in most web browsers on Windows?
Which single keypress typically opens the Start menu on a Windows PC?
Which Windows keyboard shortcut immediately locks the current user session and screen?
Which key captures a screenshot of the entire screen to the clipboard on many Windows keyboards?
Which function key typically reloads or refreshes the current page in many web browsers?
Which keyboard shortcut opens a new blank document or window in many desktop applications?
Which keyboard shortcut opens the Print dialog so you can print the current document on Windows?
Which key cancels or closes many dialogs and stops ongoing operations in GUI applications?
Which keyboard key moves keyboard focus to the next field, button, or control in forms and dialogs?
On macOS Safari and many mac browsers, which shortcut focuses the address bar for quick typing?
Which function key toggles full-screen mode in many desktop web browsers and applications?
Which key combination opens the Windows Quick Link menu for power tools and settings?
Which keyboard shortcut opens the Run dialog on Windows for quickly launching commands or apps?
Which shortcut minimizes all open windows and shows the desktop on a Windows PC?
Which shortcut opens Task Manager directly without the intermediate Windows security screen?

medium.question: In most command-line shells, which key combination sends an end-of-file (EOF) to the terminal session?
Which key sequence suspends a foreground process and returns control to the shell in Unix-like systems?
Which shortcut in many browsers opens a private or incognito browsing window?
Which Windows keyboard shortcut opens the built-in Snipping or screen clip tool for selecting a screen region?
Which Windows shortcut opens Clipboard History after it has been enabled in settings?
Which macOS keyboard shortcut opens the Force Quit Applications window to terminate misbehaving apps?
Which browser shortcut focuses the address bar for a search or URL entry in most desktop browsers?
Which keyboard shortcut clears the terminal screen, producing a fresh prompt in many shells?
Which terminal keybinding starts an interactive reverse search through command history in Bash?
Which keyboard shortcut opens a new private browsing window in Firefox and Chrome on macOS?
Which Windows shortcut opens the Task View interface to manage virtual desktops and windows?
Which Ubuntu desktop shortcut commonly opens a new terminal window by default?
Which browser shortcut reopens the last closed window or tab in the correct order in many browsers?
Which keyboard shortcut in many applications moves the cursor to the beginning of the current line?
Which web browser shortcut opens Developer Tools in most major desktop browsers?
Which Chrome and Firefox shortcut opens the Clear Browsing Data dialog directly?
Which editor command in Vim writes changes to disk and quits the editor in command mode?
Which Emacs key sequence saves the current buffer to its file from any editing state?
Which PowerShell cmdlet lists all commands, functions, and aliases available in the session?
Which combination in Windows opens the Security Options screen that includes lock and sign-out choices?
Which keyboard shortcut in many editors redoes the previously undone action on Windows systems?
Which Chrome shortcut completes the current entry in the address bar by adding ".com" heuristically?
Which keyboard shortcut in Excel selects an entire column quickly when a cell in that column is active?
Which Windows shortcut toggles between showing the desktop and restoring open windows quickly?
Which keyboard combination opens the browser's address bar search box focused for a rapid search query?
Which Linux/Unix command prevents a process from being terminated when the shell exits?
Which Git command opens an interactive rebase editor to reorder or squash commits?
Which browser shortcut toggles between open tabs in many desktop browsers in sequential order?
Which keyboard shortcut in many apps moves the cursor to the end of the current line quickly?

hard.question: Which POSIX signal does the terminal send to a foreground process when the user presses Ctrl+C?
Which POSIX signal is typically sent when pressing Ctrl+\ (backslash) in a Unix-like terminal?
Which terminal feature prevents pasted multiline commands from immediately executing and wraps pasted text safely?
Which tmux default prefix key starts command sequences for tmux window and pane control?
Which command makes a script file executable by the current user on Unix-like systems?
Which utility in X11 environments reports keyboard events and keycodes when keys are pressed?
Which Windows tool remaps keyboard shortcuts system-wide in modern Windows versions as an official Microsoft utility?
Which Emacs notation prefix represents the Meta modifier often mapped to the Alt key on modern keyboards?
Which shell history expansion token reruns the previous command when prefixed by sudo (for quick elevation)?
Which key sequence in Vim returns the cursor to the position before the last jump, using normal-mode commands?
Which tool shows and allows remapping of modifier keys and layout options on X11 systems?
Which Windows shortcut sends a screenshot of the currently active window to the clipboard?
Which shell builtin displays the list of currently stopped or backgrounded jobs in the current session?

Which terminal flow-control key temporarily pauses output to prevent overflow on slow connections?
Which keyboard shortcut moves a window to the left half of the screen on Windows for snapping?

Which command in many shells reads and executes commands from a file in the current shell environment?
